unnormalised: **Automotive News: Recent Vehicle Launches Showcase Technological Advancements**
normalised: **Automotive News: Recent Vehicle Launches Showcase Technological Advancements**

unnormalised: The Indian automotive sector has witnessed a flurry of vehicle launches in recent weeks, showcasing significant technological leaps. Dr. Sharma, Head of Automotive Engineering at IIT-Madras, emphasizes the industry's shift towards electrification. "We're seeing manufacturers embrace hybrid and fully electric powertrains, driven by both consumer demand and government incentives like the Rs. 2,00,000 subsidy on EVs," he noted during a recent panel discussion in Mumbai.
normalised: The Indian automotive sector has witnessed a flurry of vehicle launches in recent weeks, showcasing significant technological leaps. Doctor Sharma, Head of Automotive Engineering at I I T-Madras, emphasizes the industry's shift towards electrification. "We're seeing manufacturers embrace hybrid and fully electric powertrains, driven by both consumer demand and government incentives like the rupee two hundred thousand subsidy on E Vs," he noted during a recent panel discussion in Mumbai.

unnormalised: Tata Motors recently unveiled its new compact SUV, the 'Girnar,' boasting a range of 450 km on a single charge. Maruti Suzuki, meanwhile, launched the 'Indica NXT,' a refreshed version of their popular hatchback, featuring advanced safety features and a claimed fuel efficiency of 28 kmpl. These launches highlight the growing focus on both performance and affordability in the Indian market. Many showrooms, now spanning over 5,000 sq ft, provide immersive experiences to customers. Expect further innovation as manufacturers cater to the evolving needs of the 'aam aadmi'.
normalised: Tata Motors recently unveiled its new compact S U V, the 'Girnar,' boasting a range of four hundred and fifty kilometer on a single charge. Maruti Suzuki, meanwhile, launched the 'Indica N X T,' a refreshed version of their popular hatchback, featuring advanced safety features and a claimed fuel efficiency of twenty eight kilometer per liter. These launches highlight the growing focus on both performance and affordability in the Indian market. Many showrooms, now spanning over five thousand square feet, provide immersive experiences to customers. Expect further innovation as manufacturers cater to the evolving needs of the 'aam aadmi'.
